channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Monetary Policy and Financial Conditions: Meaningful Relationship?
item.description: An analysis of the Fed's recent rounds of quantitative tightening (QT) and quantitative easing (QE) yields actionable insights about the relationship between monetary policy and financial conditions.

item.title: The world's wealthy need to pay up to address the climate crisis, says the top expert behind the Paris Agreement
item.description: Decarbonizing isn't cheap or easy, but the wealthy are responsible for the bulk of the emissions—can we actually hold them accountable?

item.title: Five Quotes from Financial History to Guide Trustees
item.description: If you serve as a trustee of an institutional investment plan, these five quotes may help guide your decisions for the benefit of those who depend on your stewardship.

item.title: Forget employees. Artificial Intelligence may upend entrepreneurship as we know it
item.description: For every decent idea, a cottage industry of as-good-or-better imitators will emerge almost immediately.

item.title: Stocks for the Long Run? Setting the Record Straight
item.description: Stocks are a good investment long-term, providing that you dial in your expectations. New historical findings provide a richer, more complete understanding of international returns.

item.title: Traders who scooped up Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway shares at a massive $620,000 discount during ‘glitch’ will have their deals canceled by the NYSE
item.description: In an update posted at 9 p.m. last night NYSE said it would "bust" all the "erroneous" trades of Berkshire Hathaway stock at or below $603,718.30 a share.

item.title: Rethinking Retirement Planning Amidst Aging Demographic Frontiers
item.description: Forward-thinking approaches to policy and wealth management are needed to ensure a better financial future across generations and income brackets.

item.title: Hedge funds paying for 'literally insane' short on U.K. stocks
item.description: Hedge funds have been caught off guard by sudden valuation jumps as companies eye cheap U.K. stocks.

item.title: Book Review: The New World Economy in 5 Trends
item.description: A diligent economist and an eclectic bookworm serve up an analysis of megatrends that will have the greatest impact on economies and investments: innovation, productivity, climate, multiglobalization, debt, and aging.

item.title: De Beers ditches lab-grown diamonds and shifts focus to natural stones — as it looks beyond mining giant Anglo
item.description: Ending a six-year program that broke one of its oldest taboos.
